en

ame earth as the enemy of one's lord.

The suicide of the ronin thus became=
 a social issue. Many were the

 These feelings were

ry to this book

atically been expressed by these warriors."

ike) is beside the point. The point is that something large and

uld well be that "something fundamental" suggested by Weinberg:

ove all. At the same time it is also possible to see

nti-authoritorial opinion. This sympathetic

rnment had deemed criminal is in itself
